Description: Study of an oarsman, seen from behind, his left foot raised on the side of the boat Red chalk
Curator's comments: Bodmer suggested that this was a study for the oarsman in a lost composition of the Holy Family's return from Egypt known from a study at Windsor Castle (2330; Wittkower no. 37, fig. 6; Bohn no. 285). Bohn dates this to the early 1590s, a decade or so before the Windsor sheet. Loisel suggests that this drawing may have inspired the figure seen from the front in Annibale's 'Landscape with a fishing scene' of the late 1580s in the Louvre, Paris (D. Posner, 'Annibale Carracci :a study in the reform of Italian painting around 1590', New York, 1971, II, no. 44, pl. 44b). Lit.: H. Bodmer, 'Lodovico Carracci', Burg bei Magdeburg, 1939, no. 39; R. Wittkower, 'The Carracci Drawings at Windsor Castle', London, 1952, under no. 37; C. Loisel, in exhib. cat., Bologna, Palazzo Magnani, 'Gli affreschi dei Carracci', 2000, fig. 20; C. Loisel, 'Musée du Louvre, Cabinet des Dessins, Inventaire Général des Dessins Italiens, VII, Ludovico, Agostino, Annibale Carracci', Paris, 2004, pp. 31 and 83, n. 71 and 271; B. Bohn, 'Ludovico Carracci and the art of drawing', Turnhout, 2004, no. 5 (with further literature)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Jonathan Richardson Senior (L.2183 and L.2984)
